intro: Hieracium dermophyllum subsp. nufenense, commonly known as the Nufenen hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has a taproot system and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and ecological traits compared to other Hieracium species.
